description: From Middle English arme hole, armehole, arm hole, arm-hole, armhole, arm-hool(e), armole, harmehole; equivalent to arm +‎ hole.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, now rare Midlands dialect) A human armpit.
examples: An aposteme gendred in þe purgynge places, þat is to say, of þe brayne vnder þe eres, of þe herte vnder þe arme holes, of þe lyuer in the schares.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, rare and obsolete) Similar structures in other animals.
(fashion) A hole for an arm in a piece of clothing.
examples: He... violently pull'd off her Riding-Hood, and tore it at the Arm Holes in pulling it off.
